newsitem.title: UK: Next touches record high, boosted by market.
newsitem.headline: Next touches record high, boosted by market.

text.p: Shares in Next Plc pushed to a record high on Thursday, squeezed higher amid a stock shortage after a week in which the stock has risen amid strong results from fashion retailers, traders said.
Next shares were up 11p at 643-1/2 by 1200 GMT after earlier rising a high as 645, surpassing its previous peak of 639p set on March 11.
The stock rose earlier in the week on strong figures from rival Oasis Stores Plc and other signs of strength in the retail sector.
Volume was moderate at 926,197 shares, with traders saying there were quite a few buyers in the market.
"There's a squeeze in the market generally and it's up on that," one market-maker said. "A few of the other stores are up as well, but we haven't seen any real news on them."
Elsewhere in the sector Oasis was up 1p at 408-1/2p and Alexon Group rose 5p to 192-1/2.
